intro: Lychnophora platyneura, commonly known as the Brazilian peppertree, is a shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, white flowers. The plant produces small, red, fleshy fruits that are edible for some animals but toxic to others. It is often found in moist, tropical environments and can become invasive in certain regions. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
